Pre-Game Insights: The St. Louis Cardinals and the Milwaukee Brewers meet Monday in MLB action from American Family Field.
This will be the first installment in a three-game series.
The Cardinals will send out Andre Pallante as a starter, who is 6-6 with a 3.80 ERA in 24 games (15 starts).
The Brewers will go with Freddy Peralta as the starting pitcher, who is 9-7 with a 3.70 ERA over 27 starts.
Five of the Brewers' last six day games against NL Central opponents have gone UNDER the total runs line.
Eight of the Cardinals' last 10 day games against National League opponents have gone UNDER the total runs line.
The 'Inning 1 UNDER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Cardinals' last four day games against National League opponents.
The 'Inning 1 UNDER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Brewers' last three home games.
